Legal_Issue: Whether the IRB erred in rejecting expert evidence regarding the applicant's memory impairment
Evidence_Assessment: IRB dismissed expert reports from Dr. Devins and Dr. Stall; Dr. Stall's report included objective tests showing memory impairment which was overlooked
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim denied due to perceived lack of credibility
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's memory impairment, expert evidence not properly considered
Legal_Rule: The IRB must properly consider all evidence, including expert reports, and cannot reject them solely based on the claimant's perceived lack of credibility
Procedural_Issue: Failure to adequately consider expert assessments
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: IRB failed to fairly assess expert evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Expert reports from Dr. Devins and Dr. Stall, including objective memory tests
Applicant_Challenge: IRB's rejection of expert evidence on memory impairment
Court_Result: Judicial review allowed, case remitted for redetermination by a different IRB panel
Legal_Rule_Source: Case law and statutory obligations under IRPA
Legal_Provision: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Governing_Rule: The IRB must properly consider all evidence, including expert reports
